user_query: really isn't that important to the actual books I'm getting sidetracked enough about adaptations let's get into my actual Dog Man thoughts right off the bat this movie is of course so visually fantastic especially when the color blue is involved the skies made me drool I love how this office looks so cozy and yet so cold the animation goes back and forth from being really smooth and then throws in a few characters with lower frame rates which I was unsure about at first but I got used to it and it works surprisingly nice a lot of the side characters have this puppet clay-like look that stood out in front of the backgrounds perfectly as for movement everything moves with a lot of extra weight and felt very satisfying and articulate specifically in scenes where Dog Man or Petey jump in the air I cannot wait till this comes to streaming and I can examine all the smear frames because I know they're going to be crazy the camera and shot movements are also really insane especially in the scene as the camera Trails behind officer Knight driving like the mother from Ponyo The Sound and Music paired with this scene gives kind of a Batman TV show Vibe as does a lot of the soundtrack and it does such a good job making the film feel silly but still dramatic in general there's so many little hidden elements to laugh at funny self-aware building names title cards during the news report segment making meta jokes about the characters on screen everything in this world comes to life and you
